speaker: Dungeon Master & NPCs
lines: Griffin McElroy

speaker: Magnus Burnsides
lines: Travis McElroy

speaker: Merle Highchurch
lines: Clint McElroy

speaker: Taako Taaco
lines: Justin McElroy

speaker: Episode 41
lines: The Eleventh Hour - Chapter One

speaker: Griffin
lines: Previously, on The Adventure Zone

speaker: The Director
lines: That is where you come in, the reclaimers. This is actually a very hard position for us to fill because most of the time anybody who discovers one of the Grand Relics is unable to fight off the temptation to claim it for their own.

speaker: Boyland
lines: My name… is Boyland.

speaker: Magnus
lines: [Laughing] Excuse me?

speaker: Griffin
lines: You see a crystallized figure, a dwarven figure with a cigar in his mouth.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, God, it’s Merle!

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, you actually recognize this crystallized figure as Boyland.

speaker: The Director draws a curtain and you can see a window into the Cerebro Chamber, like you’ve seen three times now. These huge columns of light stab through the ball—
Justin
lines: So that’s four, so that’s the glove, the belt, the stone…

speaker: Griffin
lines: The Oculus.

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s like halfway, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: More than halfway— we’re more than halfway there. Yeah, that’s—

speaker: Taako
lines: More than halfway! Good for us, wow!

speaker: The Director
lines: This is going better than I ever could’ve expected. You three—

speaker: Merle
lines: [Laughing] Us too!

speaker: The Announcer
lines: Can our heroes recover the final three Grand Relics before they’re crushed by the weight of their incompetence? No, they can’t. It’s The Adventure Zone!

speaker: [Theme music
lines: Déjà Vu by Mort Garson]

speaker: Griffin
lines: New story time!

speaker: Clint
lines: Yaaaay!

speaker: Griffin
lines: New story day!

speaker: Justin
lines: Crack open the dusty volume.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Crack this dusty volume right open.

speaker: Justin
lines: The tales…

speaker: Travis
lines: [Rhythmically] Crack that dusty volume!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, hold on, no, it’s new story time. If there’s dust on the volume, then that’s a manufacturing error.

speaker: Justin
lines: I like to imagine you pulling down a tome, an age-ripened tome from the shelves.

speaker: Travis
lines: Maybe the book’s alive, like in The Pagemaster, and it’s screaming as you rip it open.

speaker: Justin
lines: “Another tale of the McElroy boys, you say.”

speaker: Clint
lines: Bound in human skin.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Just like in The Pagemaster, all of the voices of this arc will be Whoopi Goldberg. Please enjoy.

speaker: Uh, I’m gonna start this arc off on a somewhat dour note. The three of you— it’s been, let’s say it’s been, like, a month and a half, maybe two, so it’s late winter, early spring. And the three of you are attending the Rites of Remembrance for everyone’s favorite character, Boyland. The Director has been putting this off. The Rites of Remembrance are when a Bureau member goes down in the line of duty, their information is fed to the Voidfish so as to avoid uncomfortable questions from the world below as to their whereabouts.
Travis
lines: So Boyland is gone but not yet forgotten. But soon.

speaker: Griffin
lines: But in— like, no joke, in like a minute and a half, both of the things. And you’re in the Voidfish’s chambers, where you actually haven’t been in a while. And it is just as you remember it. You’ve got the big tank with the Voidfish, jellyfish-looking giant guy, floating in the tank. And pretty much everybody from the Bureau is here.

speaker: Travis
lines: Even Pringles?

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, Pringles is in jail. Where he belongs.

speaker: Travis
lines: [Huffs] Still?

speaker: Justin
lines: God, I hope this arc is about prison-breaking out Pringles.

speaker: Travis
lines: Are we eventually going to find out what happened to Pringles and what the justice system is like in this organization?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Maybe. Maybe I just put him in jail because of his bad name. It’s possible, that’s entirely possible.

speaker: Justin
lines: Hey, Griff, can I ask a canon question?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, please.

speaker: Travis
lines: “How do cannons work?”

speaker: Justin
lines: I know— yeah, is it sparks or gunpowder, what’s up in there? Suction? Uh, no. When somebody is fed into the Voidfish—

speaker: Griffin
lines: The people aren’t fed into the Voidfish, that’s ghoulish.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, man!

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, what do you— they write their names down or whatever. What happens to, like, physical evidence of that person’s existence on Earth? Like, how are physical, uh…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, no, I’ll break down some of the, like, Voidfish… because I’ve been thinking a lot about the Voidfish lately.

speaker: Justin
lines: As have we all.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think the Voidfish has kind of an ability where not only do they erase information, right, when they’re fed information they erase it from the world— ooh, it’s storming outside, that’s some nice ambiance. Not only does it disappear from the world, except for those who are inoculated, I think the Voidfish’s powers are a bit broader than that in that they sort of implant whatever you need to kind of write your own narrative as to— write your own way around that information.

speaker: So it’s not like the stuff just disappears because that would be weird, and I did kind of set up that that’s how Angus joined the Bureau of Balance, is because people kind of knew there were, like, these edges of the periphery of their memory that something was wrong, somebody was missing, and in investigating those missing persons that’s how Angus ended up there. But I think the Voidfish has an ability where it’s just like, Boyland is gone, and it’s like, there’s a big chair here that they can’t read the name that’s etched into the chair of Boyland. So, like, maybe that chair is just for a family friend that they also can’t remember, you know what I mean?
Travis
lines: There’s brain fog over it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, fog is a good way of putting it. Not only does the Voidfish erase the information, it fills in the gaps, or it enables you to sort of fill in the gap.

speaker: Justin
lines: But that does not apply to those of us who have been inoculated.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, you— no. They don’t disappear from you, they just disappear from everybody else in the world, which is a lot of people.

speaker: Justin
lines: Many.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Right.

speaker: Clint
lines: Like Marty McFly’s brother and sister.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So it’s been a couple months, you’re at the Rites of Remembrance, everybody is here except for Pringles—

speaker: Travis
lines: It took us a couple months to get the Rites of Remembrance together?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, the Director’s kinda been putting it off. And everybody’s here— Avi’s actually not here, Avi’s been missing for a week or so. I said missing, that sounds ominous, he just hasn’t been around.

speaker: Clint
lines: Foreshadowing!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And here’s the thing about this ceremony everybody is so sad. Like, everybody is so bummed out. And you get the impression that maybe you guys are the only people in this whole organization that were not, like, gigantic Boyland fans.

speaker: Justin
lines: Boyland boys, as he preferred to call them.

speaker: Griffin
lines: This room is full of Boyland boys, and everybody’s crying and, like, sharing their favorite stories— and Boyland’s not, like— listening to their stories, Boyland sounds like a dope dude. He always brought in donuts to the office, and people loved that. And he had a lot of fun jokes that were not offensive, they were really— they were people pleasers.

speaker: Boyland was a people pleaser, and people seem really bummed out, and people are getting up there and giving some speeches. Killian and Carey, who served with him as regulators, have some, like, totally rad war stories, and just, everybody seems super upset. And you are clued into the fact that maybe you guys should’ve gotten to know Boyland a little bit better, because he sounds like a total party animal.
Travis
lines: Wow. You know what, I stand by it. I think that they were all blinded by, they were too close to the situation, and we were able to see him for what he really was a dick.

speaker: Clint
lines: A giant dick.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Laughing] Is this your speech? Is this the speech you’re giving to the room?

speaker: Travis
lines: No. [Griffin Okay.] Magnus would never say that. But Travis would.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Do you wanna say anything? Is there anything you want to do in this scene?

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m gonna raise— oh, this is great because I haven’t gotten to use this a lot— my flagon that makes everything, like, doubly potently alcoholic.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: And I’m getting real drunk at this wake.

speaker: Magnus
lines: [Drunkenly] To Boyland! [pronounced “Boy-lund”]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Everybody joins you.

speaker: Bureau members
lines: To Boyland! [pronounced “Boy-lund”]

speaker: Griffin
lines: —they all shout, and raise their own flagons that they all have for some reason. So the Director walks in, and walks sort of close to the tank. And she has a few rolls of parchment, which she hands over to Johann, who’s been playing sort of accompaniment to this scene. He’s been playing a slow, sad tune on his cello, probably that he wrote specifically for Boyland.

speaker: Clint
lines: Good God!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, he’s really weepy. And Johann takes it and puts it into the tank and pulls the lever, and you see these three rolls of parchment float up into the tank. And the Voidfish wraps some of its tendrils around these three rolls of parchment and pull it into its body.

speaker: And suddenly, instantly, as soon as these parchments that contain information about Boyland are consumed, the Voidfish illuminates from within in a way that you’ve never really seen before. The Voidfish has always had, like, a sort of faint spiral galaxy, like, nebula of stars floating around inside of it that you can see, but this is like all of those galaxies explode at once. You see these bright strands of red and yellow and green just sort of zipping around inside its body, there’s a lot of, like, light activity in there. And as soon as that happens, Johann like, steps back, and he’s like,
Johann
lines: I’ve never seen a reaction like this before.

speaker: Travis
lines: I lean down to Taako and Merle.

speaker: Magnus
lines: You guys see this too, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Everybody sees this. Everybody’s like, everybody’s actually kind of scared a little bit. They’re stepping back, because it’s like— the Voidfish is— there’s like a fireworks show going off inside of it. And the Director says,

speaker: The Director
lines: Oh, my god. It’s, uh… it’s his comically large family, Johann.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Johann’s like,

speaker: Johann
lines: Oh, oh. Oh, God, that’s horrible. Sorry— whenever the Voidfish blocks information that it consumed, that’s what causes those lights inside of it. It’s like a little alarm, if you will, showing the people out there trying to think of the things that the Voidfish blocked. So that’s all… that’s, like, his four hundred kids and wives and husbands and stuff. That’s… god, that’s rough.

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, but they don’t know, right? I mean, they— it’s not— it’s only sort of rough from sort of like an ethical perspective, practically speaking.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Merle
lines: They’ve already forgotten him.

speaker: Taako
lines: Think about it, maybe the Voidfish created for them a brand new dad.

speaker: Magnus
lines: A better dad.

speaker: Merle
lines: Who wasn’t a giant dick!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Johann says,

speaker: Johann
lines: [Weepy] Yeah. Really, if you think about it, his family has it easy, ‘cause the rest of us have to go on knowing what a great dude we lost. [Tearful moaning]

speaker: Taako
lines: As I’ve always said in every situation, I’m the one hurt most by this.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah. Is this, like, a physical strain for the Voidfish? Is this… I mean, that just seems like a lot of work.

speaker: Clint
lines: Is it grunting?

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, it’s not— it doesn’t seem—

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m not asking you, Griffin, I’m asking Johann.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, he says, uh.

speaker: Travis
lines: I did it in character voice, damn it.

speaker: Johann
lines: [Teary] Um, I mean, the Voidfish doesn’t seem like it’s particularly distressed by all this. It’s just, whatever reaction is happening inside of there, it’s— the Voidfish is blocking a lot of information right now. It’s rough.

speaker: Taako
lines: Johann, do you know, does he need this? Like, does the Voidfish get antsy if he doesn’t get fed from time to time?

speaker: Johann
lines: I don’t know that it’s a he. But, um, I feed it my compositions from time to time to just kind of keep it fed and happy and fat. I love the Voidfish very much.

speaker: Taako
lines: I guess you could say it’s your number one fan. Hey— hey, Johann, do your t-shirts come in XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXL?

speaker: Johann
lines: Yeah, and they have hundreds of armholes. You’ve cheered me up.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The Director, who’s like very— she’s really upset. You see the Stone of Far Speech that she has around her neck, her pendant, start to light up again, and she turns and talks to the voice coming from inside of it. You actually hear that it’s Avi.

speaker: Justin
lines: [imitating Navi from the Legend of Zelda series] Hey! Listen!

speaker: Griffin
lines: She has a short conversation with N-Avi [pronounced “nuh-avi”]. She turns to the three of you and says,

speaker: The Director
lines: It’s time.

speaker: Travis
lines: [Crosstalk] You have to die.

speaker: The Director
lines: Collect yourselves and then meet me in my office for a briefing.

speaker: Travis
lines: Before I do that, Magnus just puts his hand on the glass and stares at the Voidfish, just… mesmerized by the flashing lights inside of it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Very quickly, it puts up one of its tendrils and puts it up against your own. And then you hear it actually sing that song again that it sang a few Lunar Interludes ago, the one that’s just seven notes.

speaker: [The Voidfish’s seven-note song begins in the background.]
Clint
lines: Let’s listen.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, let’s listen into the Voidfish’s—

speaker: Clint
lines: Seven-note song.

speaker: Travis
lines: The dirge of the Voidfish.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, it does have some sort of reaction to that, Magnus.

speaker: Travis
lines: I love this Voidfish, you guys.

speaker: Clint
lines: You’re also hammered.

speaker: Travis
lines: I have animal proficiency, I don’t know what to tell you.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The Director mentioned to you that it’s time. About a week ago, she mentioned that—

speaker: Travis
lines: Can I— I would like to jump in here really quick, by the way—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Please.

speaker: Travis
lines: —and thank all of our listeners, and I mean this sincerely, for finally explaining to me what it means to have proficiency in stuff.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Somebody explained to me how proficiency in thieves’ tools worked, and I was like, “Oh, duh”.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: And it all made so much sense to me. Thank you, everyone.

speaker: Clint
lines: And you didn’t know that?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, please, please, please.

speaker: Travis
lines: [Crosstalk] Well, I didn’t know, like, what it translated to to have proficiency in, like, a tool.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Dad practically wrote these rules. So, if you ever need—

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, I would like you to be a little bit more informed in the future.

speaker: Griffin
lines: If you ever need to go to dungeon school, you can take Clint McElroy’s correspondence course.

speaker: Travis
lines: Dungeons and Dragons and Daddies.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Ew, actually, that sounds weird.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s not great. The Director mentioned that it’s time. About a week back, she mentioned that she had a beat on a job coming up, and she mentioned that it was big, but it was gonna be a little while before she could figure out how to get a plan of attack going and to keep it under your hat.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, okay, so we know what’s up. When she says “It’s time,” it’s like, a finger to the nose.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You know that she has a job. Do you want to move into her office and get briefed?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Goodbye, Voidfish!

speaker: Griffin
lines: It does its little song again, but quieter this time. But those lights inside of it are still popping off.

speaker: Travis
lines: I sprinkle some food onto the top of its bowl.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Well, its food would be, like… “When I was a little boy, I had a, y’know, a rabbit named Douglas,” and it’d be like, “Mmm, thank you! [Eating noises] Douglas is gone”.

speaker: Travis
lines: This is fun, though, because I wouldn’t forget it. I could feed the Voidfish any— if it was like, “One time I slighted my friend Jim, like, we were supposed to split it 50-50 and I gave him 40 and he never forgave me”. I could put that in there and Jim would not remember that I did that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, for sure. There’s a million times that you probably farted and it was just a bad situation. And you could just, like, purge that.

speaker: Clint
lines: Is our immunity to this selective? Like, if we wanted to forget something, could we ask the Voidfish to do it?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Nope. Nah, you’ve been inoculated.

speaker: Clint
lines: ‘Cause I’m so sick of hearing about damn Boyland, I could puke!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: [Laughing] It’s been like five minutes!

speaker: Clint
lines: I know!

speaker: Griffin
lines: If you cloned the Voidfish— if you cloned that Voidfish, and then fed it the name Boyland, you might be able to get out of the way.

speaker: Travis
lines: Griffin?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Please.

speaker: Travis
lines: This does leave— Magnus has got a backstory and has got a dude that does not like him.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Could Magnus make that guy forget him? I’m not asking this in character, because [crosstalk] I don’t think this has occurred to Magnus yet—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, for sure, this is how it works, yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay. That might occur to Magnus later.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So you’ve moved on to the Director’s office. You’ve been in here a few times now. The last time you were in here was actually a bit uncomfortable because there was some tension between you and the Director, but she, uh…

speaker: Clint
lines: She and I worked that out.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, you guys really squashed the beef.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, that’s a good question, have we caught each other up on what happened in our individual things?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, if you wanted to. Maybe— I don’t know if Taako told you guys about his umbrella acting up. I don’t know if— I don’t know if you guys listened to the last fucking episode, maybe you didn’t.

speaker: Clint
lines: Still might be fun to tell each other, ‘cause…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: I think I definitely told them about, like, training with Carey, but I don’t think I told them about the box and the whole thing with Killian.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Sure, sure, sure.

speaker: Travis
lines: I don’t think I’d betray that confidence.

speaker: Justin
lines: Oh my god, I’m hearing about the things that I may or may not know from a podcast I did in fact listen to, it’s the most boring thing that’s ever happened.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So you’re in the Director’s office, let’s move on. You’re in the Director’s office. She seems bummed out, and she says,

speaker: The Director
lines: Have you collected yourselves? Are you… are you emotionally prepared to— if you need to take a day, I think we could probably give you some leave.

speaker: Merle
lines: Is it paid? Paid leave? [Someone laughs] I mean, the whole thing with Boyland has just— I’m pretty shattered, but I don’t want to lose a day of pay.

speaker: The Director
lines: If that’s what you desire, if that’s what you need, then I completely understand.

speaker: Merle
lines: [Sighs] Boy, boy, Boyland.

speaker: The Director
lines: If you are ready…

speaker: Travis
lines: Wouldn’t it be great if the whole rest of this episode and like the next three episodes was just us taking paid leave off before starting?

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Laughing] Just watching Orange is the New Black season four or whatever? Just, like, chilling? Doing some binge-watching?

speaker: The Director
lines: Assuming you’re okay, I’m ready to tell you about the next mission.

speaker: Merle
lines: Are we okay, guys?

speaker: Taako
lines: Hit it.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I feel good.

speaker: Merle
lines: Yep, we’re good.

speaker: The Director
lines: So… [Sighs] Sorry, I’m… I’m worried about the three of you on this next mission because the last one we sent you on ended up being much more dangerous than we initially expected.

speaker: Magnus
lines: And longer.

speaker: Merle
lines: And we didn’t kill as many people.

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, barely any.

speaker: The Director
lines: That will not be the case with the mission I’m sending you on.

speaker: Taako
lines: Hell yeah.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I crave blood!

speaker: The Director
lines: Because I know exactly how dangerous this mission’s going to be. Which is to say, extraordinarily.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Okay.

speaker: The Director
lines: But not for the reasons you might expect. To be frank, I don’t know what’s waiting for you on this mission, but I know what’s waiting for you at the end of it.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Hugs?

speaker: The Director
lines: And– it’s the fifth Grand Relic.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Oh.

speaker: The Director
lines: It is the Temporal Chalice [pronounced with a soft “sh” sound]. Or Chalice [pronounced with a hard “ch” sound], depending on just sort of what region you’re from. Let’s go with “chalice” [with the hard “ch”].

speaker: Merle
lines: So it’s a giant– it’s like an onion, then?

speaker: The Director
lines: It is a Relic, a cup, that gives–

speaker: Travis
lines: Dad, I want you to know I got that.

speaker: Clint
lines: Thank you.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I got it, it’s just, like…

speaker: Clint
lines: I didn’t use the amulet.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, you should… you’re lucky.

speaker: The Director
lines: It is a Relic, it is a cup that gives the holder power over the flow of time itself. You’ve been able to withstand the thrall of each of the relics that you’ve faced so far, and that is commendable, but there’s no power and no treasure more seductive than that which the Temporal Chalice presents. It will tempt you in ways that you’ve never been tempted before, and I have no way to aid you except to warn you. The power to fix your mistakes is a power that is nearly impossible to resist.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Do you know anything in regards to the extent of the power of the Chalice or who’s wielding it now, anything that can clue us into who we might face or be up against when we face the person?

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says,

speaker: The Director
lines: Allow me to brief you.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And she pulls out one of those spheres that she showed you all of those scenes of destruction from in the last episode, and taps it. And you see another sort of display pop up over it.

speaker: This one is showing a large, brown, dusty canyon. It’s actually a series of canyons that are just sort of weaving a bunch of channels into the ground. Dry channels, they’re not rivers, it’s just dry canyons, all made of red clay. And you see one of the canyons, the largest of this network of canyons, has a pretty big opening in it right sort of in the heart of this series of canyons. And inside of that opening you see a circle, and it looks like it was actually, like, drawn into this projection. It is a perfect circle. And she says,
The Director
lines: We discovered this anomaly several weeks ago and we’ve been trying to figure out a way to breach it. We can’t tell what it’s protecting. It is a force field, and whatever is powering this force field, the power is starting to slightly wane. That’s how we were able to discover it. Avi has been researching a form of transportation that will be able to get the three of you through the field and contacted me during the Rites of Remembrance for Boyland to let me know that he’s had a breakthrough. Avi had to miss Boyland’s Rites of Remembrance to discover this.

speaker: Merle
lines: Aw!

speaker: The Director
lines: So I hope you’re— I hope you’re grateful for this.

speaker: Taako
lines: [Mumbling] I didn’t know that was an option.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says,

speaker: The Director
lines: I have no intel on what’s inside of this force field, save for some information on the bubble itself. It’s nearly a mile and half in diameter. It is impenetrable and opaque. We can’t get through it through any sort of common methods. It’s not just a dome, it’s perfectly spherical, it extends down into the ground as well. And it’s some sort of— I’ve referred to it as a force field; it’s actually some sort of time distortion. It doesn’t block force, it blocks time. So you can’t move through it for that reason. If you tried to punch your fist through it, your fist wouldn’t be stopped by a barrier, it would just… stop.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Now, hold on, are you sure? Because I’ve punched a lot of things.

speaker: The Director
lines: I’m pretty sure that it— that wouldn’t swing it.

speaker: Magnus
lines: [Skeptically] Okay. We’ll see.

speaker: The Director
lines: We can’t see through the barrier. Whatever’s in there, it could be large. It could be… I mean, it’s a mile and a half in diameter. It could be a fortress, it could be some sort of army encampment. It could be a whole city. We don’t know what’s waiting for you in there. All we know is that the Temporal Chalice is what is projecting that field, and it is almost certainly where you will find it.

speaker: Magnus
lines: So how—

speaker: Taako
lines: What’s the main thing the Temporal Chalice does?

speaker: The Director
lines: The Temporal Chalice simply has— for lack of a better term; its powers are broad and that’s what makes it such a frightening force— it has control over the flow of time. But it can also give the user a sort of broader dominion over time. It was able to essentially create a barrier composed of time, which is news to me. But it’s just the more reason why we need to get this out of the hands of whoever’s using it and we need to get it into our hands and then just destroy it.

speaker: Magnus
lines: So how exactly do you suggest we do that when it’s creating a barrier that we can’t move through or see through or get through?

speaker: The Director
lines: Avi has figured something out, so we’re going to send you down to the…

speaker: Griffin
lines: What’s the name of this area? Dry… no, Dry Bones is the name of an enemy from Mario. That won’t do it.

speaker: Travis
lines: Gucci Gulch.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Gucci Gulch is pretty good. That’s something, though, right?

speaker: Travis
lines: I think it’s the taint.

speaker: Clint
lines: We have to go down to the taint.

speaker: Travis
lines: We’re sending you to the devil’s taint.

speaker: Clint
lines: You got ravine. You got gulch.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, I’m looking. Um…

speaker: Justin
lines: How about The Blasted Lands?

speaker: Griffin
lines: The Blasted Lands is from World of Warcraft.

speaker: Justin
lines: ‘Kay, how about The Not-Blasted Lands?

speaker: Travis
lines: How about Flavor-Blasted Lands.

speaker: Clint
lines: The Grand Canyon. [Travis Mhm.] But you spell it with two D’s. The Grandd Canyon. The Taco Bell Grande Canyon.

speaker: Justin
lines: I was about to say The Arid Wastes, but that’s a map in Starcraft. Blizzard, can you get off my nuts for a second?

speaker: Travis
lines: How about Tatooine?

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, I’ve got it.

speaker: The Director
lines: We’re going to send you down to The Woven Gulch to meet up with Avi and figure out a way of entry. Once you get in there, again, I don’t know what dangers await you, but once you’ve bested them, just… [Sighs] I’m sorry, I’m having kind of a hard day, and I don’t—

speaker: Taako
lines: What’s going— hey, what’s going on with you?

speaker: The Director
lines: It’s Boyland.

speaker: Merle
lines: [Exasperated] Oh, god.

speaker: Taako
lines: Oh, right, yeah.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah, yeah, yeah.

speaker: Merle
lines: If I get control of this Chalice, I’m gonna go back in time and make everybody forget about forgetting Boyland.

speaker: Director
lines: No, see, this is explicitly what I’m talking about. That— oh, I thought you were going to say “save Boyland”.

speaker: Merle
lines: No. No, not gonna save Boyland.

speaker: The Director
lines: Listen, that’s what I’m talking about. You goof, ‘cause you’re a goofer.

speaker: Merle
lines: I am a goofer.

speaker: The Director
lines: But you can’t— this thing’s gonna come at you from all sides, and if you give in to it, you’ll lose control, and we’ll have to send in the regulators after you, and none of us want that.

speaker: Merle
lines: Let ‘em try.

speaker: Taako
lines: I kinda want that.

speaker: Merle
lines: We’ve beat them before, haven’t we?

speaker: The Director
lines: Not at all.

speaker: Magnus
lines: So the goal is, get this Chalice and do not use it.

speaker: The Director
lines: Do not use it and get out.

speaker: Merle
lines: Is there a palace where they keep the Chalice?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Good question. What if we have to use it to stop it?

speaker: The Director
lines: That’s goofy talk.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Well, you’re not gonna be there, you don’t know.

speaker: The Director
lines: I’m sending you boys— to quote your imprisoned friend Pringles, “Once you pop, the time control don’t stop”.

speaker: Taako
lines: Okay, do we need to stop by and see Avi or are we just headed down planetside?

speaker: The Director
lines: Ah, Avi’s already planetside.

speaker: Merle
lines: Is it hot down there? Is it really hot?

speaker: The Director
lines: It’s probably sticky? If you wanna wear shorts, this is—

speaker: Taako
lines: Oh, wait a minute, we gotta get new looks. We gotta get summer looks!

speaker: Merle
lines: [Clapping and cheering] Shorts! We need shorts.

speaker: [“No Dogs on the Moon!” begins playing in the background]
Travis
lines: [Chanting] Shorts, shorts, shorts, shorts—

speaker: Justin
lines: [Chanting] Fantasy shorts, fantasy shorts— [Travis joins in] Fantasy shorts, fantasy shorts—

speaker: The Director
lines: Okay, this is— yes.

speaker: Travis
lines: Magnus definitely has cargo shorts, don’t try to tell me I do not.

speaker: The Director
lines: I will set this up— I will set this up for you if you will get on— this will be sort of your signing bonus for this job, is I will secure for each of you some cool shorts.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Okay, but on one condition. I want a changing room for three, like, three different compartments. I want Killian and Carey and Noelle to be there, all kinda like shaking their head yes or no when we come out and display it. Does that sound good to you guys?

speaker: Merle
lines: Say Yes to the Shorts! Say Yes to the Shorts.

speaker: Justin
lines: And— please don’t trip, I’m wearing a skirt. Don’t even bug on that, of course I’m wearing a skirt.

speaker: Clint
lines: A kilt!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Like a man-kilt?

speaker: Justin
lines: Not a kilt. Like a skirt.

speaker: Clint
lines: You don’t wanna go with the desert kilt?

speaker: Travis
lines: Merle would have a utilikilt, and that’s a fact.

speaker: Justin
lines: No, like a skirt, but like a magical one.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Maybe jodhpurs, we’re going to the desert.

speaker: Clint
lines: Jodhpurs! Do they make jodhpur shorts?

speaker: The Director
lines: And away you goooooo!

speaker: Clint
lines: Whoa-oh-oh-oh-oh!

speaker: Griffin
lines: She’s, like, holding both of her hands extended and slowly walking towards you, pushing you away towards the door.

speaker: The Director
lines: Awa— off we go on another adventure.

speaker: Travis
lines: Griffin, can I just ask you a question real quick?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Completely out of curiosity, having nothing to do with what’s going on right now.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Please.

speaker: Travis
lines: What class is the Director? I mean, what kind of skill set does she have?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I mean, she definitely is magical. She is a, you know, either a wizard or a sorcerer, or… something. She has magic.

speaker: Travis
lines: We have not seen her wield that power yet, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: So I mean, she has a couple times, she used— The only thing I can kinda think of is when you guys— god, this is a pull. When you guys first did the test of initiation, she like tapped her white oak staff on the ground and you guys went to sleep essentially and woke up in the testing chamber.

speaker: Travis
lines: So it’s safe to assume she’s pretty powerful?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, yeah, yeah. I mean, she’s in charge here, she’s got some skills.

speaker: Clint
lines: Why don’t you ask me? I’m the one that just spent some quality time with her.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Getting to be best buds.

speaker: Clint
lines: We are kinda best buds now.

speaker: Travis and Justin
lines: [At the same time] Mud buds.

speaker: Clint
lines: When she’s covered with mud, she looks like Charlize Theron in those Huntsman movies.

speaker: [Everyone talking over each other about the Huntsman movies]
Griffin
lines: Nobody’s actually seen those movies.

speaker: Clint
lines: They haven’t?

speaker: Justin
lines: No, give those fuckers to the Voidfish.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Where would shorts— I guess… not Fantasy Costco, I wanna say, like, maybe Leon—

speaker: Travis
lines: Fantasy Old Navy? Ye Olde Navy?

speaker: Justin
lines: I guess it would be New Navy, right? [In Taako’s voice] Have you guys heard about the new store, it’s just called Navy. We think it’s gonna be around for a long time.

speaker: {Clothing bit ends at 31
lines: 58. CTRL+F to “Well, listeners”}

speaker: Griffin
lines: You are in the clothing department of the Fantasy Costco and Garfield the Deals Warlock is helping you pick out shorts, because, like— it’s like that scene in The Matrix where a bunch of different shelves of guns come at you but it’s all just, like, shorts and utilikilts and skirts and, like, lightweight summer fashions.

speaker: Taako
lines: I want one like Jared Leto wore to the 2015 iHeartRadio Music Awards.

speaker: Garfield
lines: You’ve got it!

speaker: Clint
lines: You’re welcome for those awards, by the way.

speaker: Justin
lines: Thanks, Dad.

speaker: Garfield
lines: What color? I think a salmon would look good on you,  Taako.

speaker: Taako
lines: Well, his was black, but I think something light for the clime would be great, so… maybe kind of like a mauve? [mispronounced as “m-ow-ve”] A mauve? [mispronounced as moo-ahve]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, he gets you the exact color that you’re picturing in your mind’s eye. How high or low-cut is this— what are we talking, like, at the knee?

speaker: Justin
lines: I mean, flirty.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Fingertips?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Flirty length. And Dad and Travis, what kind of shorts do you want?

speaker: Travis
lines: I would like some— ahem.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I would like some cargo shorts, but if they could be enchanted in some way that I don’t have to worry about sand getting up in there, you know what I mean?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, sure, sure, sure. Sure, that’s— Don’t worry about that.

speaker: Magnus
lines: And something that’ll keep the pockets from leaking.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I can’t believe how much time we’re spending on this.

speaker: Travis
lines: I’ve put a lot of thought into my magical cargo shorts.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yes.

speaker: Garfield
lines: And Merle, for you?

speaker: Merle
lines: Jodhpurs. I like the jodhpurs idea, and I want them right above the knee with garters.

speaker: Travis
lines: I love this because Merle’s, like, short.

speaker: Garfield
lines: Define that— define that word and use it in a sentence!

speaker: Merle
lines: Jodhpurs? Uh, give me those jodhpurs with the big flaps at the sides.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, but those are in no way shorts, you understand? This is arguably the worst possible summer wear.

speaker: Travis
lines: No, but he will look like a 1950s director.

speaker: Clint
lines: Absolutely. Yes!

speaker: Travis
lines: With a second set of knees.

speaker: Clint
lines: Like Cecil B. DeMille.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, he gets you some weird pants that are baggy at the butt and thigh area. These are the least flattering pants that I’ve literally ever seen.

speaker: Travis
lines: They’re not really baggy, I thought they had built-in angles.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, not the jodhpurs I’m seeing.

speaker: Clint
lines: Think of, like, riding pants. Think equestrian pants.

speaker: Garfield
lines: No, yeah, definitely. You want me to cut these off at the knee for you, just to give you sort of a—

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah, but I want, like, a belt around the bottom so I can affix them. So sand doesn’t blow up my hoo-hah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He brings you some jodhpurs and he cuts them off at the knee to make you jort-purs, I guess? That’s a fun one.

speaker: Clint
lines: Jort-purs!

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s a fun one. And then he takes out his wand and he goes,

speaker: Garfield
lines: Don’t tell the Director about this!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he waves it over your shorts and jort-purs and skirt so that they are protected completely from humidity and stickiness and grit. And says,

speaker: Garfield
lines: That one’s on the freeski for my most loyal customers.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He winks.

speaker: Taako
lines: Thanks, Garfield. Can we leave now?

speaker: Garfield
lines: I wish you would.

speaker: Justin
lines: Well, listeners who are just joining us again, we’re assuming you fast-forwarded through that last segment— [Clint guffaws] welcome back to The Adventure Zone. We’re still here, still doing it, and we’re ready to get busy for you.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Important question, what color are the jorts and the jort-purs?

speaker: [“No Dogs on the Moon!” begins playing in the background]
Travis
lines: Camo. Mine are camo.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Jesus. Daddy?

speaker: Clint
lines: Plaid.

speaker: Griffin
lines: What color plaid? That’s nothing.

speaker: Clint
lines: Black, green, and red.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, cool. God, I’m glad we settled all that.
36-3815 commercial break}

speaker: Griffin
lines: The three of you are in the hangar of the Bureau of Balance getting ready to launch to your destination. Avi’s not here, Avi is the hangar operator. So you’re not really sure who’s going to be blasting you out of this cannon until they reveal themselves… it’s a small boy who walks out from behind the cannon.

speaker: Travis
lines: Ango?

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s Angus McDonald.

speaker: Taako
lines: Son of a bitch.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he looks… he looks pretty nervous. He’s like,

speaker: Angus
lines: [Shakily] Hello— uh, hello, sirs! Um, I’m honored—

speaker: Taako
lines: Angus, how’s the magic going?

speaker: Angus
lines: Oh, it’s going very good. Um, I— my favorite magic spell, if I knew how to use it today, would be to fire you guys off to your destination without killing you. But—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Cool.

speaker: Angus
lines: I’m sorry, I’m just very nervous. It’s my first time manning the cannon, and, um, Avi showed me how to use it, but I’m just a little boy, and some of the machinery is very complicated. But I think I’ll be able to get you where you need to go all safe and sound and away from volcanoes and stuff.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Ango, if there was one person I trusted to do this well, you’re definitely on the short list of people that that might be.

speaker: Merle
lines: Short list! Hahaha!

speaker: Travis
lines: That wasn’t supposed to be a mean joke, Dad, but thank you.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He motions you up the stairs to the loading platform and into the glass ball. You guys didn’t have this launch protocol for your last adventure, yours was more floating-canoe-based, so it’s been a little bit since you’ve mounted up for a blast-off like this.

speaker: Clint
lines: You mean in the vomit comets?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. You hopping in?

speaker: Justin
lines: Hell, yes.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mmkay. Yeah, you hop in and shut the seal, the little circular door behind you, and the back of the cannon starts to lift you up into the cannon. The last thing you see, through the sliver of light between the cannon hatch and the cannon, is Angus’s face, and he looks like he’s about to break down into tears.

speaker: Travis
lines: I give him a thumbs-up.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: I give him one finger.

speaker: Griffin
lines: ‘Kay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Well, we don’t have to be mean every time, Dad.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, we’re homies now.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And, yeah, you’re sealed into the cannon, and you hear,

speaker: Angus
lines: [Breathing heavily, speaking shakily] Three, two, one, mark?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And you are launched out of the cannon, and, yeah, it’s been a while since you’ve done this.

speaker: Travis
lines: And he forgot to open the door.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And you die and that’s the end of The Adventure Zone.

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s been The Adventure Zone, guys. Wow, what a ride.

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m glad we ended on that shorts high note.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And you’re— no, you’re launched and you are sailing through the skies at several hundred miles an hour. You have a lot of actual horizontal velocity this time, so you’re getting a good look at the ground below you as you sort of sail above it all. And you watch yourselves go over the black circle of glass that used to be Phandalin. You go over Neverwinter, you fly over Goldcliff and the deserts surrounding it.

speaker: Clint
lines: [Laughing] So all of the sites of our greatest triumphs.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, uh, you fly over the deserts of Goldcliff—

speaker: Justin
lines: Rather discreetly, while we’re doing the soaring, I cast Stone Skin on myself.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Really?

speaker: Justin
lines: Well, this motherfucker just said he could kill us in fiction that’s binding to reality, why would I not cast that on myself?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, and, uh, I guess—

speaker: Travis
lines: I read the in-flight safety manual a couple times. Way too much. More than normal.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, if you’re reading that, Dad, make a perception check, Dad.

speaker: Clint
lines: Of course. Certainly. Perception check. [Dice roll]

speaker: Griffin
lines: You have a bonus because you have those eyeglasses.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, yes, my glasses!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And whatever your skills give you.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay. 16.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, yeah, so that’s enough. You see out of the corner of your eye Taako turn to— his skin turns to stone.

speaker: Merle
lines: You little shit!

speaker: Taako
lines: Well, it’s because this way, if anything happens to us, I can heal you. I wanted to— it’s for the team.

speaker: Merle
lines: Well, then why didn’t you cast it on me?

speaker: Taako
lines: I only have so many slots, my man.

speaker: Merle
lines: [Inhales like he’s gonna yell, but doesn’t] Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And you see yourself floating and starting to descend into the Woven Gulch, and it does look like just a big knot made out of these canyons. And these canyons look deep. A few of them that are sort of not attached to the larger weave have— it looks like there are some clouds in them, like they have their own little self-contained weather systems. Not, like, fog, like proper clouds in them.

speaker: But the one you’re sinking into, the largest of all of these, is clear, and you’re falling down into it, and you’re getting very very close to the ground, and very very close to the ground now—
Travis
lines: Oh, we pull the lever.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, you pull the lever. This is a pretty rough stop, this is gonna be a rough landing. You feel— I forget if there’s— there’s not a parachute, it just kind of—

speaker: Justin
lines: Brakes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: —the momentum of it starts to come to a stop. But you hit the ground pretty hard. It’s red clay—

speaker: Travis
lines: I pulled the lever, Griffin. I remembered that I was supposed to do it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, but you pulled it— you did pull it pretty late.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, but, like, you as the DM didn’t remind your stupid players that they had to pull a stupid lever.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, I didn’t know this was a baby game for childreuhnnn.

speaker: Clint
lines: Ooh!

speaker: Justin
lines: Oh, dunk.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, but you don’t take any damage or anything. And the ball is fine. But you do roll a couple times and you come to almost a perfect stop directly in front of Avi, who is just looking at you with this, like, grimace on his face, just preparing for death.

speaker: Travis
lines: During that whole time I curled my body to protect Steven the magic fish.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Been a while.

speaker: Travis
lines: In case anyone was worried— yeah. He’s fine. Still swimming around. Still being a fish in my pocket.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [High-pitched] How long do goldfish live? [Someone snorts]

speaker: Travis
lines: He’s magic, Griffin. Longer than, like, two months.

speaker: Clint
lines: [High-pitched] How long do goldfish live inside a pocket?

speaker: Travis
lines: He’s magic as shit, y’all.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. So you skid to a halt in front of Avi. You are now in front of this massive, massive— it is a sphere, but to you it just looks like a dome on the ground that is reaching high, high up into the sky. It looks weird— it looks weirdly, like silvery? But it looks like when you look into it you are seeing exactly what the other end of it would see, like, a natural— you know that camouflage, like that Metal Gear Solid shit where you have a camera on your back so when you look at the front you see what the camera on your back’s showing you? That’s kind of what it looks like. It looks like a distortion, so it kind of looks like you can see through it, but you’re actually just seeing past it, right?

speaker: Travis
lines: Got it.

speaker: Clint
lines: Got it.

speaker: Travis
lines: You’ve explained it very well four different ways.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You see Avi. And you see a gigantic, way bigger than the one you just came out of, cannon, that Avi basically has pointed, not quite point-blank, but maybe about ten feet away from the dome pointed directly at it. And as the door opens, he says,

speaker: Avi
lines: Wow, that was some pinpoint shootin’. That was good work, whoever did that up there did, uh— oh, it was Ango, right.

speaker: Magnus
lines: It was Ango!

speaker: Avi
lines: Yeah, I trained him. Yeah, boy, that was a hole in one!

speaker: Magnus
lines: I pulled the lever.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He sees you, Taako, and he goes,

speaker: Avi
lines: Taako, what happened to your whole skin situation?

speaker: Taako
lines: You know, uh, spray tans went wrong.

speaker: Avi
lines: Oh man, if you have Stone Skin on, that should’ve thrown off the trajectory of the— oh, man, if you— if you hadn’t done that, you probably would’ve smashed right into the side of this thing.

speaker: Merle
lines: He’s a hero!

speaker: Taako
lines: I’m a hero!

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says,

speaker: Avi
lines: Okay, boys, here’s the situation, here’s what I’ve figured out.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He pops out some little scanner that he’s got with him, a little tricorder-looking doo-dad, and points it at the barrier. You see sort of a sine wave appear on it, and the waves are sort of contracting and expanding, and he says,

speaker: Avi
lines: Whatever energy this thing’s giving off—

speaker: Griffin
lines: This isn’t what Avi sounds like, it’s been a while since he’s talked. I think he had more of, like, a surfer bro voice, but I kind of lifted that for Carey. I’m sorry my voices are getting so out of whack, everybody. Doing my best. He says, uh,

speaker: Avi
lines: Whatever energy this thing’s giving off, it fluctuates and it gets weaker and then it gets stronger. My hypothesis that I’ve tested out with, like, a couple rocks, and I did it with a skull, is that if you launch something with enough speed and momentum right when this thing’s at its weakest energy signature… guys, I’m like 94 percent sure. if I shoot you out of this big cannon, directly at this thing, right when the energy signature is at its weakest, you’re gonna pass right through. It’s gonna be totally great, totally great.

speaker: Merle
lines: What percent? Wh-what percent?

speaker: Avi
lines: 94. Like, 93 to 95.

speaker: Magnus
lines: That’s still an A, my bud, let’s do it!

speaker: Avi
lines: That’s an A, yeah, sure.

speaker: Griffin
lines: What’s everybody’s passive perception like?

speaker: Travis
lines: My passive perception is 11.

speaker: Justin
lines: How would I know that, Griffin?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think it’s like eight plus whatever— or ten plus whatever your perception bonus is.

speaker: Clint
lines: Mine’s 15.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Merle, you notice out of your corner of your eye, coming from behind you in the direction you were shot down, you see something move and sort of disturb the clay earth about thirty feet behind you. It looks kind of like— you know that hilarious movie Caddyshack? And there’s that groundhog that causes all the folks just no end of trouble. Just so much trouble.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, that gopher.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um… Is it a gopher?

speaker: Clint
lines: Yes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Love that movie. Anyways, you notice something disturbing the earth and moving in your direction. And it’s coming pretty quick.

speaker: Merle
lines: Hey, guys, look!

speaker: Taako
lines: What is it?

speaker: Merle
lines: [Laughing] It’s a gopher!

speaker: Taako
lines: Sweet.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Cool.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, so, if you’re not gonna do anything about it, the shape moves towards you, and—

speaker: Merle
lines: Fellas, we need to brace ourselves for impact. Something’s coming at us under the ground.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Crosstalk] It branches into three of these little moving patches of clay earth, almost like it’s starting to encircle this group of people. And quickly emerging from the ground, you see three very large, very purple worms pop out of the ground, almost Tremors-style. They are— what is sticking out of the ground is about ten feet long, about a car tire in terms of thickness, with these three sharp yellow pincers at their mouth forming kind of a beak. They are screaming like they are in distress and they are upon you. Let’s roll initiative.

speaker: Justin
lines: Course now there’s a 20.

speaker: Travis
lines: Uh, I had a seven.

speaker: Clint
lines: I have a 15. Justin rolled a 20.

speaker: Justin
lines: Twenty, of course, there’s my 20.

speaker: Travis
lines: Does that mean he gets a special bonus attack? ‘Cause he rolled a crit?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Nope.

speaker: Travis
lines: [Quietly] I think it does…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, Taako is first in the order. You got these three worms, they’re all about— they’re sort of encircling you. They look pretty gnarly, and they sound like they’re in distress, and they are about 10 feet away from you.

speaker: Justin
lines: So are they literally surrounding us, or are they 10 feet apart like coming at us?

speaker: Griffin
lines: They’re not literally surrounding you, but they are about 10 feet apart, 10 feet away, forming like a triangle.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, well, I am going to cast… Thunderwave. ‘Cause that seems like a good thing. Okay, so I can hit two of them on this. I’m gonna cast it as a level three spell.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, wow, okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: I can do an additional 2d8 damage with it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: What do they have to do, some sort of saving throw?

speaker: Justin
lines: They have to do a constitution saving throw.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, I’ll do them one at a time.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, that’s fine.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Dice rolling] First one fails. [Dice rolling] Uh, the second one got an 18, so that’s a success, I imagine.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, so you hit one of them.

speaker: Justin
lines: So he takes two… six… 11… 13 damage.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. This thing, like, squeals, and gives out kind of a pathetic cry as it— and you knock it back, right?

speaker: Justin
lines: Unsecured objects that are completely within the area of effect. And since they’re still somewhat submerged—

speaker: Griffin
lines: I’m actually gonna say that you knock it out of the ground. Like, the force of this thing pulls the rest of its body out of the ground. There wasn’t a whole lot in there sort of tethering it, so you knock it out of its hole. This thing is fully exposed, and it’s just sort of wriggling around on the ground and kind of crying.

speaker: Next in the order is the worms. The one you hit is going to— I’m gonna say it’s prone, so it’s gonna spend its turn righting itself, reaching— lifting the top part of its body and then smashing down into the ground and burrowing down. And then it’s going to use another move to kind of move over and burrow up and hide behind one of its unharmed fellow purple worms.

The other two are going— you see their mouths start to glow red, and the two of them are casting Scorching Ray. They’re both gonna aim at you, Taako, since you just hurt the boy. The other boy. [Justin
lines: Okay.] That is a spell attack throw. The first one [dice rolling] is— what’s your AC?

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, right now?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, you have Stone Skin.

speaker: Justin
lines: That doesn’t affect my AC. My AC is 13.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Wait, Stone Skin doesn’t affect your AC?

speaker: Justin
lines: No, sir. It gives me resistances to certain types of damage. Interesting.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Is fire one of those types of damage? [Dice rolling]

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh… non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, slashing.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, so no. The second one’s gonna be a hit.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Hold on, this is an attack, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, it is a ranged spell attack, it’s not a melee attack.

speaker: Travis
lines: As long as there’s an attack roll against him, instead of a save, I can do protection.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, okay. Yeah. Okay. [Dice rolling] That’s a 19 versus AC, it’s still gonna hit.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay. Sorry, I tried.

speaker: Justin
lines: Hey, well. C’est la vie!

speaker: Clint
lines: Good job.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Dice rolling] That is 21 points of fire damage—

speaker: Justin
lines: Hachi machi!

speaker: Griffin
lines: —as you get lit up by this one. And another one tries to blast you, but it curves around and it hits the barrier and just kind of diffuses. Doesn’t do anything. [Justin Okay.] Uh, next in the order is Dad.

speaker: Clint
lines: I’m gonna cast my new spell, Flame Strike, because we’ve got two of them right next to each other, right? Because one of them’s hiding behind the other one?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yes yes.

speaker: Clint
lines: So I cast this, it’s a vertical column of divine fire that roars down from the heavens—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Jesus.

speaker: Clint
lines: —in a location you specify. Each creature in a 5-foot radius, 40-foot high cylinder centered on a point within range, has to make a dexterity saving throw.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. [Dice rolling] That is an 11, not gonna do it. What is your…

speaker: Clint
lines: Spell DC?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yes.

speaker: Clint
lines: Sixteen.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Holy shit. Okay, they super don’t save.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay, well. Each one of them takes 4d6 fire damage—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Damn, son.

speaker: Travis
lines: Wow.

speaker: Clint
lines: —wait a minute. And 4d6 radiant damage.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Good lord, did you just burn your, like, nuke?

speaker: Travis
lines: What level spell is that?

speaker: Clint
lines: Level five, nosy.

speaker: Travis
lines: Nice.

speaker: Clint
lines: [Dice rolling] Six. Eight. Four. I’m up to 18.

speaker: Justin
lines: Eighteen.

speaker: Travis
lines: Wait.

speaker: Clint
lines: One. That’s 19, right?

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s the fire, right?

speaker: Travis
lines: How did you get an eight on a d6?

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh. [Crosstalk]

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s actually a super good question, Travis, and I think it’s something worth looking into. I think maybe— let’s take that one back to the judges.

speaker: Justin
lines: Let me do some investigation here on my end.

speaker: Griffin
lines: We’re doing a camera— we’re doing a judges’ review right now, and I think there may have been something a little bit fishy with those rolls.

speaker: Clint
lines: I’m trying again, I’m trying again.

speaker: Justin
lines: You see a seven on there? If not, you’re good.

speaker: Clint
lines: [Dice rolling] One. Five, so that’s six. Two, so that’s eight. Two, so that’s ten. So ten fire damage. Four… five, so that’s nine… another five, that’s 14… One. 15. So all in all, 25 damage.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Good lord. Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: On each.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, the one that was fresh takes that damage and looks— it squeals like a pig. Like it is very, very upset by that attack. And the one that was already damaged is, like, lying on the ground— not dead, but like, it’s just kind of twitching and the one that is still undamaged looks at it and it does another sort of soft wail. And next up is Travis.

speaker: Travis
lines: It’s actually kind of making me sad. So we’ve got one undamaged—

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s when we notice that they were rushing at us with brochures for how to best enjoy the Woven Gulch.

speaker: Travis
lines: “Welcome to Woven Gulch.”

speaker: Justin
lines: “Welcome to Woven Gulch. Here’s some coupons for the TCBY.”

speaker: Travis
lines: “Our band performs every Friday.”

speaker: Justin
lines: “We’d love if you guys could come out. Free beer for the ladies.”

speaker: Clint
lines: “Ice cream social on Sunday!”

speaker: Travis
lines: “Also, we’re giant worms. I know that’s off-putting, but if you just— oh, oh, oh, I see.”

speaker: Justin
lines: “Oh, oh, oh, okay.”

speaker: Clint
lines: “Thank you for not judging by appearance and not killing us.”

speaker: Justin
lines: “Oh, no.”

speaker: Travis
lines: See and drink ‘ems.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Travis, what’re you doing?

speaker: Travis
lines: So we have one completely untouched, one that’s in bad shape, and one that’s in super bad shape, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. Yeah, yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: So I’m gonna go after the one that’s undamaged, I guess. [Griffin ‘Kay.] So, I’m gonna run up to it and switch to two-handed axe.

speaker: Griffin
lines: ‘Kay. Yeah, you’ve got some options now, huh?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah. And I’m gonna attack it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: ‘Kay.

speaker: Travis
lines: [Dice rolling] That’s a 12 plus eight— uh, plus nine, that’s a 21.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. That’s a hit.

speaker: Travis
lines: And that’s…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Do you wanna— I assume you’re gonna attack it— let’s start doing this, ‘cause your turns, now that you’ve got all these different shits you can do, your turns are gonna start going long. I think if you’re gonna take multiple attacks on a thing, if you’re planning on taking bonus actions, why don’t you just roll a bunch of d20 and let’s just like, you know what I mean?

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay. Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: If you need to break it up for, like, strategic purposes, I totally am down with that, but if you think, “My move for this action is gonna be, I’m gonna hit this worm three times,” just then I would prefer you just do it.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay. So I will remember that that one is going to be a goading attack, and then I’ll attack again. [Dice rolling] Eight plus nine, 17.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That is insufficient.

speaker: Travis
lines: Poopy.

speaker: Griffin
lines: But your goading attack hits.

speaker: Travis
lines: That is a nine plus five, so that’s 14 damage.

speaker: Griffin
lines: ‘Kay.

speaker: Travis
lines: And then plus six, so you need to beat a 20 saving throw to avoid the goading attack.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Of wisdom?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Not this thing’s strong suit. [Dice rolling] That is 16, so no.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, yeah, so any attack not against me will have disadvantage. Now I’m gonna use Cunning Action to dash away!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: Dash away, dash away!

speaker: Griffin
lines: We need to figure this out, because I’m pretty sure both Cunning Action— we need to talk about this after the show. Cunning Action and Bonus Attack both use a thing called the bonus action. In combat you have move action, action, bonus action, reaction, and I think Bonus Attack uses that bonus action, so you can’t do both that and Cunning Action in the same turn. But we will figure that out.

speaker: Travis
lines: But that, to me, would be an action surge. Because I just get two attacks. I don’t think that’s a bonus action.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Can you only action surge once per battle?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, cool. We’ll say that’s what happened, cool. Alright you move away from this thing. Uh, Justin, back up to you, Taako.

speaker: Travis
lines: And Griffin, just so you know, because I think someone might point out— I think if I dash away, I get an attack of opportunity against me. If you disengage and move, you don’t get an attack of opportunity.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, so I do get an attack of opportunity.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: When you hit it, this worm starts to whine and squeal also, and it does not do its attack of opportunity against you. It just kind of rears back and almost cowers. Taako, it’s your turn.

speaker: Travis
lines: Well, we need to stop attacking these guys.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, but, like, they attacked me.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, but like, what if we just— we’re beating the shit out of them right now. What if we just didn’t attack them this round and saw what they did?

speaker: Clint
lines: Who are you?

speaker: Justin
lines: You know what? I’m—

speaker: Taako
lines: I’m into it!

speaker: Merle
lines: [Sighs]

speaker: Taako
lines: I’m gonna chill on this.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: I raised you better than that!

speaker: Travis
lines: Just so it’s in fiction, this is like— I braced for an attack of opportunity and nothing came, so it’s kind of like, “Uh?”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, so Taako, you’re going to delay your turn, just see what happens?

speaker: Taako
lines: Sure, yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, the worms are up next. The two sort-of injured ones, the ones that got hit by the flame pillar and the one that Magnus just attacked, they start to retreat, and I guess you could take an attack of opportunity against them. No, actually, you guys can use ranged attacks so you aren’t up against them. The two slightly-damaged ones sort of snake their way over to their injured third member and sort of coil around it and then all three burrow into the ground and retreat. And you hear them— these three little piggies just cry the whole way home. You hear just, like, crying. Doing a sad little purple worm cry. As they run away.

speaker: Clint
lines: So I’m the bad guy. I’m the bad guy here.

speaker: Justin
lines: Well, I mean, I’m a bad guy, I cast a spell on them before.

speaker: Travis
lines: I chopped them with my axe.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, all right.

speaker: Travis
lines: We all three attacked, we just didn’t kill them. Which, can I just say, ooh, strong character growth from all three of us. [Sounds of agreement] We let something live!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Avi pokes his head from behind the cannon where he was hiding, and he’s like,

speaker: Avi
lines: [Timidly] Great… great job, guys. Real proud of you. Lots of cool moves.

speaker: Merle
lines: But we won, right? We won.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, you won.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Griffin
lines: I mean, there’s a bit of moral ambiguity in there. He’s like,

speaker: Avi
lines: Okay, we should I guess get going before more of those things show up. You guys ready to blast off?

speaker: Magnus
lines: You’ve been here for a while, Avi. Have you seen something like that before?

speaker: Avi
lines: I’ve heard some, like, some stuff under the ground? But like, whatever’s down there, I guess those purple worm guys? They never breached before.

speaker: Merle
lines: Let me give you some advice..

speaker: Avi
lines: Okay.

speaker: Merle
lines: Little bit of advice. If they come back, and they pop up out of the ground, just look at them and say, “I am the Kwisatz Haderach.” They’ll leave you alone. They’ll leave you alone.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So these weren’t Dune-sized sand worms. He says,

speaker: Clint
lines: It still works!

speaker: Avi
lines: I’ve actually heard of purple worms before. They’re supposed to be, like, huge. They’re supposed to be, like, the size of a bunch of trains all bundled up together. Like, hundreds of feet long and, like, dozens of feet wide, like, big ol’—

speaker: Magnus
lines: [Voice getting higher pitched as he speaks] Were those baby purple worms?

speaker: Avi
lines: Maybe, I dunno.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Oh, shit.

speaker: Avi
lines: Let’s get this train on the— let’s get this show on the road, huh?

speaker: Merle
lines: Before we do that, can I cast Healing Word on Taako?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Do you need to take a second to figure out what to do when you actually heal someone?

speaker: Clint
lines: Look, wise guy…

speaker: Griffin
lines: You could also just— Taako can also just use his hit dice to take a short rest and recover that way.

speaker: Taako
lines: Okay, that’s fine, yeah. I’ve never done that before.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, so just roll—

speaker: Merle
lines: Trying to be part of the team!

speaker: Taako
lines: No, save your slots, my dude.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So you took how much damage, 21?

speaker: Justin
lines: Twenty-one.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So, yeah, you just roll your hit dice, which I think is 1d6 and you can spend as many as you want to get back up to full health if you want.

speaker: Clint
lines: That’s the one with six and it stops.

speaker: Justin
lines: How many— let me see how many hit dice I have on my sheet.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It should be your player level, I think.

speaker: Justin
lines: Thirteen… 15… 21. Alright, I used five.

speaker: Clint
lines: Nicely done.

speaker: Griffin
lines: All right, so you’re back up to full health. Anyone else wanna do anything before you get in the cannon?

speaker: Travis
lines: Nope! Let’s go.

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m ready.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, so you get into the cannon. This ball is a bit bigger than the one you came down in, but its most defining feature is it’s almost entirely metal, as opposed to—

speaker: Clint
lines: So one ball is bigger than the other one.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Gross. And, instead of being made out of glass, like the other ones that you usually ride in in the Bureau, there is a small, small circular porthole window that is the only source of light in this room, and as you sort of load into this new cannon ball, you notice something weird. Your momentum while you’re inside of it is off. It feels like you’re moving through jelly, almost? And he says,

speaker: Avi
lines: There’s a charm in there that, like, is gonna help reduce the momentum, ‘cause you’re gonna go from zero to—

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he refers to a little notepad, and he goes,

speaker: Avi
lines: To, um, about 800 miles an hour? Very very quickly. Oh, you guys are gonna break the sound barrier, cool. Okay, anyway—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Oh, awesome!

speaker: Avi
lines: Yeah, the charm in there’s gonna make this trip survivable, but it’s still gonna be pretty bad, so just hold onto your butts.

speaker: Merle
lines: Our own, not each others’.

speaker: Avi
lines: Whatever it takes.

speaker: Taako
lines: Is there a name for this cannon? ‘Cause I got a sweet name for it.

speaker: Avi
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Taako
lines: You should call it the Yeager [pronounced like Jäger].

speaker: Avi
lines: Yeah, this is the Yeager, and—

speaker: Justin
lines: Named after West Virginia’s own Chuck Yeager, the first person to break the sound barrier.

speaker: Clint
lines: That’s also a Jägerbomb.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, he—

speaker: Justin
lines: The Yeager Bomb, that’s a great name!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. He’s like,

speaker: Avi
lines: All right, everybody load into the Yeager Bomb.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He takes out a Sharpie—

speaker: Travis
lines: Chuck Yeager, a really big fan of the show. Thanks for Tweeting about it, Chuck, we really appreciate it.

speaker: Justin
lines: Thanks for the donations, Chuck. Thanks for all of the item submissions, like, all of them.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. Uh, Avi takes out a Sharpie and writes that on the side of the cannon. He’s like,

speaker: Avi
lines: Cool, cool, cool.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then he takes out his little scanner and points it at the dome, almost like he’s pointing a gun at it with the cannon off to his side. And you hear him count down, he’s like,

speaker: Avi
lines: Okay, I think I’ve got the timing. Now… now… now… now… I’m not gonna be able— now— to give you a countdown— now— on this one— now— so I’m just gonna— now— I’m just gonna launch it— now— you guys ready?— Now… Now… You guys ready?— Now.

speaker: Taako
lines: Yes.

speaker: Avi
lines: Okay. Mark!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And things just— you go very, very— oh boys, you go very fast. You go very, very fast. And if you were able to see outside while you were sort of spanning the distance from the end of the barrel of this cannon and into the side of the dome, you don’t see it. And all you hear is this, it sounds like a large wave rolling in. It’s really, really loud and your vision just goes white. In this white space— you’re no longer sitting in the ball, the cannonball’s just gone.

speaker: You’re just in this white space and standing in this white space in front of you, where there was this dome and Avi and the gulch, standing in this white space is a very old woman. And she is holding a large, ornate silver cup. And she—
Travis
lines: We did it!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And she makes eye contact with each of you— and says “Here you go!” [Clint laughs] No, she makes eye contact with you and gasps. And she says,

speaker: Old Woman
lines: It’s you.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then she says,

speaker: Old Woman
lines: Find me.
